properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain associated with a strong low pressure trough over eastern Hudson Bay will affect Kimmirut and Iqaluit today. As the trough passes by tonight, the rain will taper off. Total rainfall amounts of anywhere from 25 to 30 mm are expected. ### Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-20T06:22:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-19T14:23:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1543372611.2019
Area: Iqaluit, Kimmirut
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-20T13:59:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-20T05:59:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1062063444.2019
Area: City of Saskatoon, R.M. of Spiritwood including Spiritwood and Leoville, R.M. of Canwood including Debden and Big River Res., R.M. of Meeting Lake, R.M. of Leask including Leask Mistawasis Res. and Parkside, R.M. of Shellbrook including Sturgeon Lake Res., R.M. of Duck Lake including Duck Lake and Beardy's Res., District of Lakeland including Emma Lake and Anglin Lake, R.M. of Paddockwood including Candle Lake and Paddockwood, R.M. of Buckland including Wahpeton Res. and Spruce Home, R.M. of Garden River including Meath Park and Albertville, City of Prince Albert, R.M. of Prince Albert including Davis, R.M. of Birch Hills including Muskoday Res., R.M. of St Louis including One Arrow Res. and Domremy, R.M. of Redberry including Hafford and Krydor, R.M. of Blaine Lake including Blaine Lake, R.M. of Great Bend including Radisson and Borden, R.M. of Laird including Waldheim Hepburn and Laird, R.M. of Rosthern including Rosthern Hague and Carlton, R.M. of Eagle Creek including Arelee and Sonningdale, R.M. of Corman Park including Martensville Warman and Langham, R.M. of Perdue including Perdue and Kinley, R.M. of Vanscoy including Delisle Asquith and Vanscoy, R.M. of Aberdeen including Aberdeen, R.M. of Fish Creek including Alvena, R.M. of Hoodoo including Wakaw and Cudworth, R.M. of Grant including Vonda Prud'homme and Smuts, R.M. of Bayne including Bruno Peterson and Dana, R.M. of Colonsay including Colonsay and Meacham, R.M. of Viscount including Viscount and Plunkett, R.M. of Blucher including Allan Clavet Bradwell and Elstow

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Light winds and relatively cloud free skies will give conditions that are favourable for frost formation tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-20T16:50:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-20T00:51:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1668160218.2019
Area: Grand Lake and Queens County, Sussex - Kennebecasis Valley and Kings County, Kent County, Moncton and Southeast New Brunswick, Kouchibouguac National Park, Fundy National Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong westerly winds with gusts up to 100 km/h will develop late this evening in the Canada Bay area. These winds are expected to diminish below warning criteria by early Friday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-09-20T11:14:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-20T03:37:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1962499572.2019
Area: Northern Peninsula East
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clear skies and light winds will give favourable conditions for the formation of frost tonight, especially in low lying inland areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-09-20T14:59:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-20T03:37:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2019262170.2019
Area: Burin Peninsula, Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea, Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 11:53 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A severe thunderstorm is located 45 km west of Estevan and is moving northeastwards at approximately 60 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-09-20T07:52:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-20T05:54:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4289055368.2019
Area: R.M. of Lomond including Colgate and Goodwater, R.M. of Souris Valley including Tribune and Oungre, R.M. of Cymri including Midale Macoun and Halbrite, R.M. of Benson including Benson, R.M. of Cambria including Torquay and Outram, R.M. of Estevan including Estevan and Hitchcock, R.M. of Browning including Lampman, R.M. of Coalfields including Bienfait and North Portal

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 11:56 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. A severe thunderstorm is located 15 km north-northeast of Langham and is moving northeastwards at 65 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-09-20T07:55:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-20T05:57:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2476118235.2019
Area: R.M. of Blaine Lake including Blaine Lake, R.M. of Laird including Waldheim Hepburn and Laird
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winds gusting to 90 km/h will affect this community beginning overnight tonight and will persist through Friday. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-20T18:22:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-20T02:23:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1456275258.2019
Area: Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake
